english_title: The Book on Vows and Oaths

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1524
hadith_list.english_text: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "There is no vowing for disobedience, and its atonement is the atonement of an oath."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1525
hadith_list.english_text: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "There is no vowing in disobedience to Allah, and its atonement is the atonement of an oath."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1526
hadith_list.english_text: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Whoever vowed to obey Allah, then he should obey Him. And whoever vowed to disobey Allah, then he should not disobey Him."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1526
hadith_list.english_text: Another Chain with similar meanings.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1527
hadith_list.english_text: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "It is not for a person to vow about that over which he has no control."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1528
hadith_list.english_text: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "The atonement of a vow when it is not specified is the atonement of an oath."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1529
hadith_list.english_text: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "O 'Abdur-Rahman! Do not ask for a position of leadership, for if you receive it due to asking, you will be left alone with it, and if you receive it without asking, then you will be aided in it. And if you take an oath and you see that something else is better than it, then do what is better, and make an atonement for your oath."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1530
hadith_list.english_text: That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Whoever takes an oath, and then he sees that something else is better than it, then he should make atonement for his oath and then do it."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1531
hadith_list.english_text: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever swears about an oath and says: 'If Allah wills (Insha Allah), then there is no breaking of the oath against him."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1532
hadith_list.english_text: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever swears [about an oath] and says: 'If Allah wills (Insha Allah), then he will not have broken it."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1533
hadith_list.english_text: From his father (Ibn 'Umar) that the Prophet (ﷺ) heard 'Umar saying: "By my father, By my father!" So he said: "Verily Allah prohibits you from swearing by your father." So 'Umar said: "By Allah I did not swear by him after that, neither intentionally nor in narrating."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1534
hadith_list.english_text: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) came across 'Umar while he was on his mount, and he was swearing by his father. So the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Verily Allah prohibits you from swearing by your fathers. So let the one who swears, swear by Allah, or be silent."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1535
hadith_list.english_text: That Ibn 'Umar heard a man saying: "No by the Ka'bah" so Ibn 'Umar said: "Nothing is sworn by other than Allah, for I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) say: 'Whoever swears by other than Allah, he has committed disbelief or shirk.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1536
hadith_list.english_text: "A Woman vowed to walk to the House of Allah, so the Prophet (ﷺ) asked about that, and he said: 'Verily Allah is in no need of her walking, order her to ride.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1537
hadith_list.english_text: "The Prophet (ﷺ) passed by old man walking (while supported) between his two sons, so he said: 'What is the matter with this one?' They said: "O Messenger of Allah! He vowed to walk.' He said: 'Verily Allah [the Mighty and Sublime] is in no need of this person punishing himself.'" He said: "So he ordered him to ride."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1537
hadith_list.english_text: Another Chain from Anas that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saw a man, and he mentioned similarly.

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1538
hadith_list.english_text: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Do not vow, for the vows does not prevent what is decreed at all, and it only causes the miser to spend (of his wealth)."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1539
hadith_list.english_text: "I said:'O Messenger of Allah! I had vowed to perform I'tikaf in Al-Masjid Al-Haram for a night during the era of Jahiliyyah.' He said: 'Fulfill your vow.''"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1540
hadith_list.english_text: From this father (Ibn Umar) who said: "The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) often would swear with this oath: 'No! By the Changer of the Hearts.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1541
hadith_list.english_text: "I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying: 'Whoever frees a believing slave, then Allah frees a limb from the Fire for each of his limbs, such that he frees his private parts in lieu of his private parts.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1542
hadith_list.english_text: "We were seven brothers without a servant except one, and one of us slapped her, so the Prophet (ﷺ) ordered us to free her."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1543
hadith_list.english_text: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever swears by a religion other than Islam while lying, then he is as he said."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1544
hadith_list.english_text: "I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! My sister vowed that she would walk to the House barefoot and without Khimar (covering).' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Verily Allah will not do anything with the misery of your sister. She should ride, and cover, and fast three days.'"

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1545
hadith_list.english_text: That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever among you swears, saying in his oath: 'By Al-Lat! By Al-'Uzza!' Then let him say 'La ilaha illa Allah' And whoever says: 'Come let me gamble with you!' Then let him give in charity."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1546
hadith_list.english_text: That Sa'd bin 'Ubadah asked the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) about a vow that was due from his mother, who died before fulfilling it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Fulfill it for her."

hadith_list.title: Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1547
hadith_list.narrator: Abu Umamah, and other than him from the Companions of the Prophet (ﷺ), narrated that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
hadith_list.english_text: "Any Muslim man who frees a Muslim man, then it is his salvation from the Fire - each of his limbs suffices for a limb of himself. And any Muslim man that frees two Muslim women, then are his salvation from the Fire - each of their limbs suffices for a limb of himself. And any Muslim woman that frees a Muslim woman, then she is her salvation from the Fire - each of her limb suffices for a limb of herself."
